channel.title: Myspace SUED lol
channel.description:
myspace is being SUED by lucey sherrife or somthing like that here is the topic:
A Texas woman has filed a $30m lawsuit against MySpace.com after her 14-year-old daughter was sexually assaulted by someone she met through the site.
The suit alleges that MySpace does not do enough to protect its under-age users, according to a report in the Austin American Statesman, and includes news reports of other sexual assaults that took place after people met on the MySpace network.
The lawyer representing the family, Adam Loewy, told the newspaper: "MySpace is more concerned about making money than protecting children online."
"We feel that one per cent of that is the bare minimum, that they should compensate the girl for their failure to protect her online when they knew sexual predators were on that site," he said.
He argues that none of the registration information the site requires needs to be true, and nothing is done to verify a user's age.
MySpace.com's chief security officer Hemanshu Nigam issued a statement saying: "We take aggressive measures to protect our members. We encourage everyone on the internet to engage in smart web practices and have open family dialogue about how to apply offline lessons in the online world.
lol this made me laugh 30 million i wounder if i could try this lol

item.title: Myspace SUED lol
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

darkest_mage:

K, lets make more and more laws restricting access on the internet :D, the internet was meant to be free for everyone to use. If you choose to use the internet to commit a crime then youre fucking retarded. If you choose to disrespect ones parents then youre fucking retarded. Half of you are >15. Would you want your parents to watch every move you make on the computer? For those of you <15 or for that matter <18 youre not old enough to make statements on the way adults go about taking care of their children. Its between them and their children how they are brought up. So next time you go to comment on someone, think about it. Youre in NO position to comment.

On the contrary, I can comment on the parenting of whoever I like. I’ve been around for an ample amount of time, and know more then enough to say whether someone is doing a good or bad job.

Be it Australia’s very own Chamberlain case, or America’s countless rape cases regarding the internet, the parents are never at fault.
“Oh no, I left my less than 6 month old baby in a tent completely unsupervised and a dingo took it. It’s not my fault for not being in the tent with the baby, the dingo is in the wrong!”
or
“He tricked my daughter using Myspace into meeting him in a private place! She shouldn’t even be on that site, but it’s not my responsibility to supervise my own children, whom I have responsibility for until they’re 18 years old. Myspace should validate every new member face to face, they’re the ones in the wrong”.

Read full topic

Then why dont we just close the internet all together? lets just kill the source of the pain.
